sense.name: (cause to) form, shape, or twist into curls
sense.commentary: Includes: CURL UP Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CURL (UP) (NP2[patient]) NP1[theme] CURL
sense.examples: He curled up by Mother Bear to get warm, and he tried to go back to sleep, but he was worried. She curled her hair by dipping a hairbrush in water and twirling sections of hair around a rung from a discarded chair. A fire crackled cheerily and blue smoke curled upward and a savory odor of hot coffee hung in the air. The road curled around open fields overgrown with weeds, up onto a hill that gave a beautiful panoramic view of the main highway that passes by Jarinu.

sense.name: play the Scottish game of curling
sense.commentary: Syntax Is: NP1[agent] CURL (FOR) NP2 Includes: CURL FOR
sense.examples: In 1959, the competition was held in Quebec City and he curled third for the McDonald team. Now he curled the ball back to trap Cook plumb in front.
